meanings.definition: To shift a vehicle into a lower gear.
meanings.sent1: When driving uphill, downshifting helps control speed.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic recommended downshifting before going downhill.
meanings.sent3: The car was feeling lazy, so downshifting gave it a boost.
meanings.sent4: Downshifting gears, the car hummed a lower tune.
meanings.sent5: Downshifting smoothly, the driver navigated the sharp turn.

meanings.definition: To reduce one's work hours or responsibilities in order to achieve a better work-life balance.
meanings.sent1: She decided to start downshifting her workload to spend more time with family.
meanings.sent2: Downshifting to a part-time schedule allowed him to pursue his hobbies.
meanings.sent3: The boss was surprised when he announced he would be downshifting his role.
meanings.sent4: Downshifting her responsibilities felt like a weight lifted off her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: By downshifting, she found more time for relaxation and self-care.
